title.narrative: TORCHES (Towards Resilient Communities with Health, Equality and Safety for all) Phase II

description.narrative: AA Zim is continuing to deliver programming which encourages the questioning of power imbalances and acceptance of violence against women and girls (VAWG). Activities are taking place in schools and in communities, focused on challenging the root causes of gendered inequalities and VAWG through critically analysing use of power and identifying actions to balance power. In schools a participatory theatre approach (Tuseme) is used and in communities a there is a community mobilisation approach (SASA! Together). SASA! Together is a phased approach that works through stages of change with a whole community (moving through start, awareness, support, and action). With previous PPL funding the project launched the start phase (direct beneficiary funding). In this second phase the project is moving into the awareness phase.
